\dSo it turns out we will be hosting our annual\nfestival this year after all.\d%K%P
I had dropped by our local store to share the news\nfrom the main shrine.%K%P
\dThat so, huh? Thank ya so much Akira.\d%K%P
\dSo all's on as usual?\d%K%P
Mr. Shirane, the owner of a seedling stall, joined\nus as we all talked things out.%K%P
\dLet's discuss the details when we get everyone\ntogether. I'm going to need everyone's help to pull\nthis off.\d%K%P
\dHuh. So you're having everyone come here?\d%K%P
\dWell, a good wife should prepare for her\nguests...\d%K%P
\dNo, you can just keep sweeping.\d%K%P
\dI'll take that to mean you aren't planning on\nstopping that act of yours then? That won't do, I\nam his real wife!\d%K%P
\dJeez, give it a rest. Let's just order pizza or\nsomething. Make it easier on everyone.\d%K%P
\dConsidering how old most of our visitors are,\npizza isn't really appropriate.\d%K%P
\dSushi, then!\d%K%P
For a second I almost thought, 'Yeah, sushi would\nwork.'%K%P
\dAbsolutely not. That would be such a waste.\d%K%P
\dYukari and I will take care of the food, so you\njust finish up with the cleaning, okay Shion?\d%K%P
\dWhat?!\d%K%P
\dOkay, I get why that doesn't sit well with Shion,\nbut why you, Yukari?\d%K%P
\dBecause I'd have to leave your side, of course. I\ndon't want to be even a step away!\d%K%P
\dHiyup!\d%K%P
She drew in close.%K%P
\dOkay, then Yukari and I can switch and--\d%K%P
\dN. O. No. You can't cook anyway, Shion.\d%K%P
\dBut I can be your taste tester!\d%K%P
\dThat will be Akira's job. How does that sound,\nYukari? Ready to help now?\d%K%P
\dSo Akira will try the food I make... But that also\nmeans he'll be trying food I didn't make...\d%K%P
\dI can't allow that. No way. Absolutely not. Nope\nnope nope...\d%K%P
And just like that she started growing dark.%K%P
Since I was nearby it didn't manifest as Tatari,\nbut I could tell it had been close.%K%P
\dHehehe! Fine, let's do this.\d%K%P
\dThat settles that. Have at it, Shion.\d%K%P
\dGaaah...\d%K%P
\dWe're counting on you.\d%K%P
Kaede flashed an intimidating smile.%K%P
Shion had no way out.%K%P
The other Goddesses headed into the main hall to\nstart prepping.%K%P
\dGlad they're finally gone...\d%K%P
\dHere's your broom.\d%K%P
\dMy broom?\d%K%P
\dI just thought you'd be nice and fill in for me.\d%K%P
\dPwetty pwease...?\d%K%P
\dNo matter how cutesy you get in asking, no.\d%K%P
\dDang, I thought it'd be worth a shot!\d%K%P
\dI'll help though, so let's get it over with.\d%K%P
\d'Kay.\d%K%P
Evening came and our visitors arrived one after\nanother.%K%P
It was a true testament to countryside values how\neveryone came out to help.%K%P
\dHey Aki, why'd you have to get everyone together\nat such a late hour?\d%K%P
\dBecause I want everyone to eat, drink, and be\nmerry. We don't get many opportunities like this.\d%K%P
Social gatherings like this were a big part of\nholding a festival.%K%P
We held parties while we planned and prepared.\nThe festival itself was one big social event. We'd\neven get together again to celebrate afterwards.%K%P
Even the oldest among us got into the spirit of it,\nand were just as passionate as anyone else.%K%P
\dGahaha! I never thought I'd see the day when Lady\nKaede'd pour me a drink! All these long years were\nworth something, I guess!\d%K%P
\dYou sure can hold your liquor, Mr. Shirane.\d%K%P
Kaede was always the life of the party at these\nsorts of things.%K%P
This area had worshiped her since long ago, and the\nfeeling was especially strong among those here.%K%P
\dWho would have thought that a former Tatarigami\ncould be such a star among the people?\d%K%P
\dNow then, are you a Goddess too, sweetie?\d%K%P
Mrs. Iwakura was a local konnyaku farmer. She\nspoke to Yukari with a pleasant smile on her\nface.%K%P
\dYes, I'm Yukari Amatsu.\d%K%P
\dOh, I just knew it. A pleasure to meet you dear.\nI'm Mrs. Iwakura.\d%K%P
\dN-Nice to meet you...\d%K%P
Mrs. Iwakura, who didn't have a bad bone in her\nbody, spoke pleasantly to Yukari.%K%P
Perhaps unused to this sort of attention, Yukari\nseemed taken aback.%K%P
\dNow then, you eat up too. It's all quite good.\d%K%P
\dYeah, thanks...\d%K%P
\dYukari herself made about half of what we're all\neating tonight.\d%K%P
\dDid she now? You're quite the cook.\d%K%P
She was quick to compliment Yukari, but Mrs.\nIwakura was a great cook herself.%K%P
She was polite enough to stay humble, though.%K%P
\dI'd even wager you might be a Goddess of Cooking,\nyes?\d%K%P
\dWell, not exactly...\d%K%P
\dGoddess of what, then?\d%K%P
\dW-Well...\d%K%P
She was a Tatarigami.%K%P
But she couldn't just blurt that out.%K%P
Yukari struggled, at a loss for words, until she\nfinally found some she was comfortable with.%K%P
\dI'm a wife!\d%K%P
\dA...wife?\d%K%P
\dYes, I am a Wife Goddess!\d%K%P
She spoke without hesitation.%K%P
At this rate, people might mistake her as some sort\nof Goddess of Marriage.%K%P
\dWell, then you are just right for the Kamimori\nfestival!\d%K%P
\dYou mean cuz it's supposed to be good luck for\nthose who profess their love?\d%K%P
\dWhy yes. With a Goddess like this, people will\ncertainly believe the legend.\d%K%P
\dHehehe...\d%K%P
Yukari didn't deny a word of it, but enjoyed every\nlast bit of praise.%K%P
She hadn't exactly lied, but people were definitely\nunder the wrong impression.%K%P
\dVery well then. I'll be sure to help liven up this\nfestival.\d%K%P
\dWill you, now?\d%K%P
\dLeave it to me. I'll handle everything. I'll bring\nthe young men and women together and ensure\nthey're blessed with children.\d%K%P
\dAnd I'll start by setting a good example myself.\nWon't I, Akira?\d%K%P
She slipped right on over to me.%K%P
I let my guard down for just a moment and she was\nthere in an instant.%K%P
\dTh-That's close enough. Everyone's watching.\d%K%P
\dLet them! Let them see our love shine.\d%K%P
\dOh, to be young and reckless again...\d%K%P
Stop smiling and help me here!%K%P
\dThat's quite enough, Goddess of Breeding.\d%K%P
\dBreak it up, you two.\d%K%P
Kaede and Shion worked together to get Yukari off\nme.%K%P
\dGaaah, I was so close...\d%K%P
\dDo you always have to get so excited? Try to\nremember that Shion and I are here, too.\d%K%P
\dPlus, I'm better at handling events like this. You\nshould know that.\d%K%P
\dSo how about it? Why not tag me in as your\nproducer here?\d%K%P
\dPut me in charge and we'll be rolling in dough.\d%K%P
Despite being a Goddess of Misfortune, Shion was\nsomehow still good at making money.%K%P
Leaving her in charge would practically guarantee\nfinancial success.%K%P
\dNow hold on a minute. What are you planning on\ndoing to our festival?\d%K%P
\dNothing. Just draw in lots of tourists.\d%K%P
\dAre you sure? Should we really make this about\nprofit?\d%K%P
\dOkay, I admit it might be dangerous to leave it\nall up to Shion.\d%K%P
\dAki!!!\d%K%P
It was the truth though. Plain and simple.%K%P
\dThis should be left to me, of course. We would be\nbest to respect the traditional way of doing\nthings.\d%K%P
\dMore like the same old boring thing as always.\d%K%P
\dLet me take part and push back against\ndepopulation and declining birth rates.\d%K%P
\dLet's make this all about love!\d%K%P
Yukari stared straight into my eyes.%K%P
Her motivations were clear as day.%K%P
\dAbsolutely not!\d%K%P
\dYeah, definitely not you, Yukari. We don't need an\nX-rated festival.\d%K%P
\dSo basically you'll all complain no matter who's\nin charge...\d%K%P
We weren't getting anywhere.%K%P
Our guests had been watching the whole time. They\nwere now eyeing me intently.%K%P
\dOkay. Instead of choosing any one leader, let's\nall take the lead together.\d%K%P
\dWe'll all come up with ideas to liven up the\nfestival. How about it?\d%K%P
\dSo it's a contest, then?\d%K%P
\dHeh, that makes things way more interesting.\d%K%P
\dThis might be a good opportunity to see who can\nreally handle things best.\d%K%P
\dUh, I wasn't planning on making it this\ncompetitive.\d%K%P
\dBut it would be fun, don't you agree?\d%K%P
\dI mean...I guess.\d%K%P
I didn't really want to set them against one\nanother, but it did seem like the best way to put\non the festival.%K%P
I could almost see it now.%K%P
\dI'll make sure things don't get out of hand,\nokay?\d%K%P
\dAs long as Kaede's on top of things, Yukari\nshouldn't be able to go too wild.\d%K%P
\dWhy am I the source of contention here?\d%K%P
\dLet's just handle this fairly, okay? You shouldn't\nhave any problem with that, right?\d%K%P
\dI'll make sure not to cause Akira any trouble...\d%K%P
\dAs Akira's better half, it's my duty to be\nsupportive and help run the festival.\d%K%P
\dSame goes for his mistress! The better the\nfestival, the better the mood he'll be in!\d%K%P
\dAnd if all goes well, he'll be sure to treat me\nnicely too...\d%K%P
\dEheheh!\d%K%P
Yukari let her fantasies run wild, making the sort\nof face you shouldn't make in front of company.%K%P
But it didn't matter what anyone's goals were, as\nlong as they were committed to making the festival\nbetter.%K%P
\dAll right, so can I count on you?\d%K%P
\dYes!\d%K%P
If any trouble arose, I'd just have to handle\nthings then.%K%P
That would be my job.%K%P
\dSounds like things are settled.\d%K%P
\dI feel much better leaving things in the hands of\nGoddesses.\d%K%P
\dWell, if you're all each gonna be doing your own\nthing, might as well make something of it...\d%K%P
\dHow so?\d%K%P
\dIf yer gonna make it a competition, we might as\nwell judge the winners.\d%K%P
\dWe could cast votes. Everyone gathers 'round at\nthe end anyway, yeah?\d%K%P
We could take a poll and choose our winner.%K%P
\dNot a bad idea.\d%K%P
\dHeh, I'm going to win anyway, so sure.\d%K%P
\dI'll show you what your lovely wife is capable\nof.\d%K%P
It seemed like everyone was down for it.%K%P
It could be a good way to organize the festival.%K%P
\dNow, will we just be content with naming winners\nand losers?\d%K%P
\dI think the winner should get some kind of reward,\notherwise we'll have no motivation.\d%K%P
\dLet's say the winner gets something special from\nAkira!\d%K%P
\dI like the sound of that. Makes it all the more\nexciting.\d%K%P
\dLet's not push him, though.\d%K%P
\dI guess we'd need something, huh...\d%K%P
Deciding exactly what was tough.%K%P
I didn't want them getting carried away, but I\nstill wanted it to be something they'd work for.%K%P
\dHow about this, then?\d%K%P
\dWhoever wins gets to ask Akira for one favor.\d%K%P
Her eyes were already twinkling.%K%P
I could read her like a book.%K%P
\dI'd hate to make you buy a prize or something, so\nthat sounds good to me!\d%K%P
\dDon't worry, I won't ask much of you.\d%K%P
\dStill putting on that good wife act...\d%K%P
\dI'm sure you'll go way overboard if you win\nthough, right?\d%K%P
\dOh, never. I just desire a modest vow.\d%K%P
\dFigured.\d%K%P
\dNo mere bodily vow, but one of the heart, which\ncombines us as one...\d%K%P
\dHehehe, I won't repeat my past mistakes.\d%K%P
I took that to mean she wouldn't creep in on me at\nnight again.%K%P
At least I wouldn't wake up to see her bound with\nKaede's ropes anymore.%K%P
\dHow about it, Akira? Do you accept my\nproposition?\d%K%P
\dOkay, fine. Your prize will be one favor from me.\d%K%P
\dOh thank you! Now I can annihilate my goals!\d%K%P
\dInteresting word choice.\d%K%P
\dEhehe, just a figure of speech. Don't you worry.\d%K%P
\dJust take it easy, okay?\d%K%P
You could never be sure what she was going to pull.%K%P
\dAt any rate, I intend on putting everything into\nthis. You'll see who's best for you.\d%K%P
\dMm-hmm. You'll see that it's me!\d%K%P
\dYou two keep bickering, I'm going to win!\d%K%P
I didn't want this to be a fight, but here we were\nanyway.%K%P
It might be tough to reel them in, but it would\ndefinitely make things more interesting.%K%P
\dOkay, let's do this.\d%K%P
And that was that. We had our plans.%K%P
Now everyone just had to make their preparations.%K%P
